content.title: Intro
content.content: -da is a Primitive Elvish suffix for the passive product of an action.[1]

content.title: Etymology
content.content: Used to denoting the passive result of the action, and when used substantivally a single product of this. Tolkien notes that "dā (variant of nā)" and "in practice words denoting products are found made with either dā or tā (lengthening owing to the influence of dā)"[2]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, "Words, Phrases and Passages in Various Tongues in The Lord of the Rings: Eldarin Roots and Stems", in Parma Eldalamberon XVII (edited by Christopher Gilson), pp. 51, 52, 68
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, "Words, Phrases and Passages in Various Tongues in The Lord of the Rings: Eldarin Roots and Stems", in Parma Eldalamberon XVII (edited by Christopher Gilson), p.52
